author: gstein
msg: Fix some pool lifetime issues with the svn_wc_statuses() function.
Specifically, we were reading entries into a subpool, placing those
into the output statushash, and then destroying the subpool. (oops!)
After changing the code to read the entries into the main pool, I
found the subpool was quite useless, so I deleted it altogether.
Some minor updates to entries.c to limit the scope of the 'path'
argument (with the subpool, it had a different lifetime, so I wanted
to limit the propagation of things with different lives as a way to
* libsvn_wc/status.c (svn_wc_statuses): eliminate the use of a subpool
for this function. also simplify the case where we're getting the
status for a single file -- we can just use svn_wc_entry().
(resolve_to_defaults): remove the PATH argument; it was unused.
(read_entries): don't set accum->path. omit PATH from the call to
(svn_wc_entry): add a comment for a future optimization

author: gstein
msg: Fix copy/paste problems: link in the right library.

author: striker
msg: Update our documentation.  It now hopefully answers
recurring questions we were seeing from users that
were setting up a Subversion server.
Formatting changes so everything lines up consistently.
(Section V): Give some hints on access control in the
configuration.  Add some references to Apaches online

author: gstein
msg: The txdelta stream's subpool wasn't used for anything beyond storing
itself and to "free" itself (i.e. it wasn't a parent of other subpools
or any other complicated pool logic). Instead, simply allocate the
stream in the provided pool and remove the "free" concept.
Per a suggestion from Greg Hudson <ghudson@MIT.EDU>, the BUILD_BATON
arguments in the delta construction functions were changed to an
explict type (rather than void *) for type safety.
argument to a 'struct build_ops_baton_t *' for type safety.
* libsvn_delta/vdelta.c (vdelta): change BUILD_BATON argument to a
(svn_txdelta): do not construct a subpool for the stream, but place
it directly into the provided pool.
